databaseops.mysql package¶

Submodules¶

databaseops.mysql.mysqldatabase module¶

This file is for mysql database connection for user to use database operations as dataframe operations

databaseops.mysql.mysqltable module¶

This file is for mysql database connection for user to use database operations as dataframe operations

class databaseops.mysql.mysqltable.MySQLTable(host: str, user: str, password: str, db_name: str, table_name: str) → None[source]¶

Bases: databaseops.mysql.mysqldatabase.MySQLDataBase

get_data_type() → dict[source]¶

This method will give you column name and there data type for entire table. :return: dictionary with column name as key and data type as value.

populate_table(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, if_exists: str = 'append') → None[source]¶

This method add dataframe data to MySQL table. :param dataframe: This is pandas.DataFrame which need to added to table. :param if_exists: This parameter will decide what to do if table name table_name already exists. Options are 'fail', 'replace' and 'append'. Note: This parameter is about table, Don't confuse it about data inside table. :return: None.

read_table(chunksize: int = None)[source]¶

This method will read table as pandas.DataFrame if chunksize is not given else it will return object which can be iterated in for loop every loop will given pandas.DataFrame of chunksize. :param chunksize: number of row you want read at one time. :return: pandas.DataFrame or Iterable object which will give pandas.DataFrame

remove_duplicates(list_of_columns: list) → None[source]¶

This method will delete duplicates rows from table based upon give list of columns. Be caution, as it will directly affect the source table with no way of going back. :param list_of_columns: list of columns names which should be used for removing duplicate values. :return: None.

set_primary_key(column_name: str, remove_duplicates=True) → None[source]¶

This method will set "column_name" as primary key for table. caution: By default it remove duplicate value for "column_name". :param column_name: If str, then it will set as primary key. If list, then composite primary key will get created. :param remove_duplicates: Either you want delete duplicate value for given columns or not. Pass this as False if you don't to remove duplicate on given columns, But it will raise exception and primary key will not be set. As primary key need to have unique values.

set_unique_keys(column_name: str, remove_duplicates=True) → None[source]¶

This method will set columns to contain only unique values. :param column_name: Column names of database table. :param remove_duplicates: Either you want delete duplicate value for given columns or not. Pass this as False, if you don't to remove duplicate on given columns, But it will raise exception.

sort_table(column: str, order='ascending') → None[source]¶

This method will perform sort operation on source database table. :param column: Base on this sorting operation will be performed. :param order: Order of sorting, Which can "ascending" or "descending" :return: None

table_filter(where: list, select: str = None, limit: int = None, chunksize: int = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

If you want read filtered table use this method. :param where: list of conditions in string format. Ex: ["column_Name = value"]

OR ["column_Name = Value and column_Name > Value"] OR ["column_Name = Value OR column_Name > Value"]
Parameters:select -- Will only return data for these columns. If None, will

return complete data :param limit: Number of rows :param chunksize: Number of rows in one iteration. :return: pandas.DataFrame if chunksize is None else iterable object.

update_table(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, if_exists: str = 'append') → None[source]¶

This method will replace data in table if it already exist based upon primary key of table. :param dataframe: This is pandas.DataFrame which need to added to table. :param if_exists: This parameter will decide what to do if table name table_name already exists. Options are 'fail', 'replace' and 'append'. Note: This parameter is about table, Don't confuse it about data inside table. :return: None.

Module contents¶

This package created for operations on mysql database as it is dataframe
